Oates published her first book in 1963, and has since published 58 novels, a number of plays and novellas, and many volumes of short stories, poetry, and non-fiction. Her novels Black Water (1992), What I Lived For (1994), and Blonde (2000), and her short story collections The Wheel of Love (1970) and Lovely, Dark, Deep: Stories (2014) were each finalists for the Pulitzer Prize.

authors.name: Jim Bishop
authors.bio: James Alonzo Bishop (November 21, 1907 – July 26, 1987) was an American journalist and author who wrote the bestselling book The Day Lincoln was Shot.

authors.name: Greg Norman
authors.bio: Gregory John Norman AO (born 10 February 1955) is an Australian entrepreneur and retired professional golfer who spent 331 weeks as the world's Number 1 Official World Golf Rankings ranked golfer in the 1980s and 1990s. He won 89 professional tournaments, including 20 PGA Tour tournaments and two majors: The Open Championships in 1986 and 1993. Norman also earned thirty top-10 finishes and was the runner-up eight times in majors throughout his career.

authors.name: J. Paul Getty
authors.bio: Jean Paul Getty Sr. (December 15, 1892 – June 6, 1976) was an American-born British petroleum industrialist who founded the Getty Oil Company in 1942 and was the patriarch of the Getty family. A native of Minneapolis, he was the son of pioneer oilman George Getty.

authors.name: Elon Musk
authors.bio: Elon Reeve Musk (born June 28, 1971) is a business magnate and investor. He is the founder, CEO, and Chief Engineer at SpaceX; angel investor, CEO, and Product Architect of Tesla, Inc.; founder of The Boring Company; and co-founder of Neuralink and OpenAI. With an estimated net worth of around US$221.4 billion as of July 2022, Musk is the wealthiest person in the world according to both the Bloomberg Billionaires Index and Forbes' real-time billionaires list.Musk was born to White South African parents in Pretoria, where he grew up. He briefly attended the University of Pretoria before moving to Canada at age 17, acquiring citizenship through his Canadian-born mother.

authors.name: Tom Brokaw
authors.bio: Thomas John Brokaw (born February 6, 1940) is an American retired network television journalist and author. He first served as the co-anchor of The Today Show from 1976 to 1981 with Jane Pauley, then as the anchor and managing editor of NBC Nightly News for 22 years (1982–2004). At this position he was one of the "Big Three anchors" along with Dan Rather and Peter Jennings.

authors.name: Jeff Bezos
authors.bio: Jeffrey Preston Bezos (born January 12, 1964) is an American entrepreneur, media proprietor, investor, computer engineer, and commercial astronaut. He is the founder, executive chairman and former president and CEO of Amazon. With a net worth of around US$135.3 billion as of July 2022, Bezos is the second-wealthiest person in the world and was the wealthiest from 2017 to 2021 according to both Bloomberg's Billionaires Index and Forbes.Born in Albuquerque and raised in Houston and Miami, Bezos graduated from Princeton University in 1986.

authors.name: Sanford I. Weill
authors.bio: Sanford I. "Sandy" Weill (born March 16, 1933) is an American banker, financier and philanthropist. He is a former chief executive and chairman of Citigroup. He served in those positions from 1998 until October 1, 2003, and April 18, 2006, respectively.

authors.name: Max De Pree
authors.bio: Max De Pree (October 28, 1924 – August 8, 2017) was an American businessman and writer. A son of D. J. De Pree, founder of Herman Miller office furniture company, he and his brother Hugh De Pree assumed leadership of the company in the early 1960s, with Hugh becoming CEO and president in 1962. Max succeeded his brother Hugh as CEO in 1980 and served in that capacity till 1987; he was a member of the company's Board of Directors until 1995.

authors.name: Don Marquis
authors.bio: Donald Robert Perry Marquis (July 29, 1878 – December 29, 1937) was an American humorist, journalist, and author. He was variously a novelist, poet, newspaper columnist, and playwright. He is remembered best for creating the characters Archy and Mehitabel, supposed authors of humorous verse.

authors.name: Jack Welch
authors.bio: John Francis Welch Jr. (November 19, 1935 – March 1, 2020) was an American business executive, chemical engineer, and writer. He was Chairman and CEO of General Electric (GE) between 1981 and 2001.

authors.name: Aristotle Onassis
authors.bio: Aristotle Socrates Onassis (20 January 1906 – 15 March 1975), was a Greek shipping magnate who amassed the world's largest privately-owned shipping fleet and was one of the world's richest and most famous men. He was married to Athina Mary Livanos (daughter of shipping tycoon Stavros G. Livanos), had a long-standing affair with opera singer Maria Callas and was married to Jacqueline Kennedy, the widow of US President John F. Kennedy.Onassis was born in Smyrna (modern-day İzmir in Turkey) and fled the city with his family to Greece in 1922 in the wake of the catastrophe of Smyrna. He moved to Argentina in 1923 and established himself as a tobacco trader and later a shipping owner during the Second World War.

authors.name: Adam Smith
authors.bio: Adam Smith (baptized 16 June 1723 – 17 July 1790) was a Scottish economist and philosopher who was a pioneer of political economy and key figure during the Scottish Enlightenment. Also known as "The Father of Economics" or "The Father of Capitalism", he wrote two classic works, The Theory of Moral Sentiments (1759) and An Inquiry into the Nature and Causes of the Wealth of Nations (1776). The latter, often abbreviated as The Wealth of Nations, is considered his magnum opus and the first modern work of economics.

authors.name: Dee Hock
authors.bio: Dee Ward Hock (born March 21, 1929) is the founder and former CEO of the Visa credit card association.
authors.description: Founder and former C.E.O of Visa Inc.

authors.name: Leo Rosten
authors.bio: Leo Calvin Rosten (April 11, 1908 – February 19, 1997) was an American humorist in the fields of scriptwriting, storywriting, journalism, and Yiddish lexicography.

authors.name: Paul Tournier
authors.bio: Paul Tournier (12 May 1898 – 7 October 1986) was a Swiss physician and author who had acquired a worldwide audience for his work in pastoral counseling. His ideas had a significant impact on the spiritual and psychosocial aspects of routine patient care, and he has been called the twentieth century's most famous Christian physician.

authors.name: Olivier Messiaen
authors.bio: Olivier Eugène Prosper Charles Messiaen (10 December 1908 – 27 April 1992) was a French composer, organist, and ornithologist who was one of the major composers of the 20th century. His music is rhythmically complex; harmonically and melodically he employs a system he called modes of limited transposition, which he abstracted from the systems of material generated by his early compositions and improvisations. He wrote music for chamber ensembles and orchestra, vocal music, as well as for solo organ and piano, and also experimented with the use of novel electronic instruments developed in Europe during his lifetime.

authors.name: W. Edwards Deming
authors.bio: William Edwards Deming (October 14, 1900 – December 20, 1993) was an American engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, and management consultant. Educated initially as an electrical engineer and later specializing in mathematical physics, he helped develop the sampling techniques still used by the U.S. Department of the Census and the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

authors.name: Cecil Rhodes
authors.bio: Cecil John Rhodes (5 July 1853 – 26 March 1902) was a British mining magnate and politician in southern Africa who served as Prime Minister of the Cape Colony from 1890 to 1896. An ardent believer in British imperialism, Rhodes and his British South Africa Company founded the southern African territory of Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe and Zambia), which the company named after him in 1895. South Africa's Rhodes University is also named after him.

authors.name: Harold Geneen
authors.bio: Harold "Hal" Sydney Geneen (January 22, 1910 – November 21, 1997), was an American businessman most famous for serving as president of the ITT Corporation.

authors.name: Robert Kiyosaki
authors.bio: Robert Toru Kiyosaki (born April 8, 1947) is an American businessman and author. Kiyosaki is the founder of Rich Global LLC and the Rich Dad Company, a private financial education company that provides personal finance and business education to people through books and videos. The company's main revenues come from franchisees of the Rich Dad seminars that are conducted by independent individuals using Kiyosaki's brand name for a fee.

authors.name: André Malraux
authors.bio: Georges André Malraux (3 November 1901 – 23 November 1976) was a French novelist, art theorist, and minister of cultural affairs. Malraux's novel La Condition Humaine (Man's Fate) (1933) won the Prix Goncourt. He was appointed by President Charles de Gaulle as information minister (1945–46) and subsequently as France's first cultural affairs minister during de Gaulle's presidency (1959–1969).
authors.description: French novelist, art theorist and statesman

authors.name: John Kenneth Galbraith
authors.bio: John Kenneth Galbraith (October 15, 1908 – April 29, 2006), also known as Ken Galbraith, was a Canadian-American economist, diplomat, public official, and intellectual. His books on economic topics were bestsellers from the 1950s through the 2000s. As an economist, he leaned toward post-Keynesian economics from an institutionalist perspective.Galbraith was a long-time Harvard faculty member and stayed with Harvard University for half a century as a professor of economics.

authors.name: David Ogilvy (businessman)
authors.bio: David Mackenzie Ogilvy (23 June 1911 – 21 July 1999) was a British advertising tycoon, founder of Ogilvy & Mather, and known as the "Father of Advertising". Trained at the Gallup research organisation, he attributed the success of his campaigns to meticulous research into consumer habits. His most famous campaigns include Rolls-Royce, Dove soap, and Hathaway shirts.

authors.name: Howard H. Aiken
authors.bio: Howard Hathaway Aiken (March 8, 1900 – March 14, 1973) was an American physicist and a pioneer in computing, being the original conceptual designer behind IBM's Harvard Mark I computer.

authors.name: Robin Williams
authors.bio: Robin McLaurin Williams (July 21, 1951 – August 11, 2014) was an American actor and comedian. Known for his improvisational skills and the wide variety of characters he created on the spur of the moment and portrayed on film, in dramas and comedies alike, he is regarded as one of the greatest comedians of all time.Williams began performing stand-up comedy in San Francisco and Los Angeles during the mid-1970s, and rose to fame playing the alien Mork in the ABC sitcom Mork & Mindy (1978–1982). After his first leading film role in Popeye (1980), he starred in several critically and commercially successful films, including The World According to Garp (1982), Moscow on the Hudson (1984), Good Morning, Vietnam (1987), Dead Poets Society (1989), Awakenings (1990), The Fisher King (1991), Patch Adams (1998), One Hour Photo (2002), and World's Greatest Dad (2009).

authors.name: Warren Bennis
authors.bio: Warren Gamaliel Bennis (March 8, 1925 – July 31, 2014) was an American scholar, organizational consultant and author, widely regarded as a pioneer of the contemporary field of Leadership studies. Bennis was University Professor and Distinguished Professor of Business Administration and Founding Chairman of The Leadership Institute at the University of Southern California.

authors.name: Ken Venturi
authors.bio: Kenneth Paul Venturi (May 15, 1931 – May 17, 2013) was an American professional golfer and golf broadcaster. In a career shortened by injuries, he won 14 events on the PGA Tour including a major, the U.S. Open in 1964. Shortly before his death in 2013, Venturi was inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame.

authors.name: Bradley Whitford
authors.bio: Bradley Whitford (born October 10, 1959) is an American actor and producer. He is best known for his portrayal of White House Deputy Chief of Staff Josh Lyman in the NBC television political drama The West Wing (1999–2006), for which he was nominated for three consecutive Primetime Emmy Awards from 2001 to 2003, winning in 2001. This role also earned him three consecutive Golden Globe Award nominations.

authors.name: 14th Dalai Lama
authors.bio: The 14th Dalai Lama (né Lhamo Thondup), known as Gyalwa Rinpoche to the Tibetan people, is the current Dalai Lama, the highest spiritual leader and former head of state of Tibet. Born on 6 July 1935, or in the Tibetan calendar, in the Wood-Pig Year, 5th month, 5th day. He is considered a living Bodhisattva; specifically, an emanation of Avalokiteśvara in Sanskrit and Chenrezig in Tibetan.
authors.description: Current foremost spiritual leader of Tibet

authors.name: Pauline Kael
authors.bio: Pauline Kael (June 19, 1919 – September 3, 2001) was an American film critic who wrote for The New Yorker magazine from 1968 to 1991. Known for her "witty, biting, highly opinionated and sharply focused" reviews, Kael's opinions often ran contrary to those of her contemporaries. One of the most influential American film critics of her era, she left a lasting impression on the art form.

authors.name: Kyle Chandler
authors.bio: Kyle Martin Chandler (born September 17, 1965) is an American actor. Making his screen acting debut in a 1988 television film, Quiet Victory: The Charlie Wedemeyer Story, Chandler's first regular television role was in the ABC drama Homefront (1991–93). This was followed by the lead role of Gary Hobson in the CBS series Early Edition (1996–2000), for which he won a Saturn Award for Best Actor on Television.

authors.name: The Buddha
authors.bio: The Buddha, was a philosopher, mendicant, meditator, and spiritual teacher who lived in ancient India. The world religion of Buddhism was founded by the efforts of him and his followers. He taught for around forty years and built a large following, both monastic and lay.

authors.name: Warren Buffett
authors.bio: Warren Edward Buffett (born August 30, 1930) is an American business magnate, investor, and philanthropist. He is currently the chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway. He is one of the best-known fundamental investors in the world as a result of his immense investment success possessing a net worth of $104 billion as of March 2023, making him the fifth-richest person in the world.

quotes.content: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that there was within me an invincible summer.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.content: To follow, without halt, one aim: There is the secret of success.
quotes.author: Anna Pavlova

quotes.content: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. And it will leave you unfulfilled.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.content: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.content: Pick battles big enough to matter, small enough to win.
quotes.author: Jonathan Kozol

quotes.content: Who sows virtue reaps honor.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.content: Nobody will believe in you unless you believe in yourself.
quotes.author: Liberace

quotes.content: Each day provides its own gifts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.content: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.content: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am not for others, what am I? And if not now, when?
quotes.author: Rabbi Hillel

quotes.content: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.content: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back, they're yours; if they don't, they never were.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: There is no duty we so underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.content: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
quotes.author: Vernon Cooper

quotes.content: This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
quotes.author: William Lyon Phelps

quotes.content: Six essential qualities that are the key to success: Sincerity, personal integrity, humility, courtesy, wisdom, charity.
quotes.author: William C. Menninger

quotes.content: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.content: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.content: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
quotes.author: Harvey Mackay

quotes.content: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
quotes.author: Amelia Earhart

quotes.content: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
quotes.author: Dale Turner

quotes.content: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.content: Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.
quotes.author: Mariella Frostrup

quotes.content: Friendship, like love, is destroyed by long absence, though it may be increased by short intermissions.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.content: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.content: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.
quotes.author: Benjamin Haydon

quotes.content: As you think, so shall you become.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.content: Genuine sincerity opens people's hearts, while manipulation causes them to close.
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.content: The universe is full of magical things, patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
quotes.author: Eden Phillpotts

quotes.content: Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.content: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
quotes.author: Lou Holtz

quotes.content: The thoughts we choose to think are the tools we use to paint the canvas of our lives.
quotes.author: Louise Hay

quotes.content: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.content: Strong beliefs win strong men, and then make them stronger.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.content: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
quotes.author: Molière

quotes.content: Well done is better than well said.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.content: We must not allow ourselves to become like the system we oppose.
quotes.author: Desmond Tutu

quotes.content: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.content: Do not give your attention to what others do or fail to do; give it to what you do or fail to do.
quotes.author: Dhammapada

quotes.content: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.content: If you wish to be a writer, write.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.content: Not every difficult and dangerous thing is suitable for training, but only that which is conducive to success in achieving the object of our effort.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.content: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.content: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.content: You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.
quotes.author: Indira Gandhi

quotes.content: There are things so deep and complex that only intuition can reach it in our stage of development as human beings.
quotes.author: John Astin

quotes.content: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
quotes.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quotes.content: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.content: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
quotes.author: Lauren Bacall

quotes.content: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.content: Those who are blessed with the most talent don't necessarily outperform everyone else. It's the people with follow-through who excel.
quotes.author: Mary Kay Ash

quotes.content: No man can succeed in a line of endeavor which he does not like.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.content: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.content: By believing passionately in something that does not yet exist, we create it.
quotes.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quotes.content: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.content: It's so simple to be wise. Just think of something stupid to say and then don't say it.
quotes.author: Sam Levenson

quotes.content: Leaders aren't born they are made. And they are made just like anything else, through hard work. And that's the price we'll have to pay to achieve that goal, or any goal.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.content: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.content: Nothing will work unless you do.

quotes.content: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.

quotes.content: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.

quotes.content: Some do not understand that we must die, But those who do realize this settle their quarrels.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: The calmed say that what is well-spoken is best; second, that one should say what is right, not unrighteous; third, what's pleasing, not displeasing; fourth, what is true, not false.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: The root of suffering is attachment.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: Whoever doesn't flare up at someone who's angry wins a battle hard to win.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.content: I don't look to jump over 7-foot bars; I look around for 1-foot bars that I can step over.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: I violated the Noah rule: Predicting rain doesn't count; building arks does.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: If you have a harem of 40 women, you never get to know any of them very well.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: In the business world, the rearview mirror is always clearer than the windshield.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: It's only when the tide goes out that you discover who's been swimming naked.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: Most people get interested in stocks when everyone else is. The time to get interested is when no one else is. You can't buy what is popular and do well.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: The only time to buy these is on a day with no 'y' in it.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: I won't close down a business of subnormal profitability merely to add a fraction of a point to our corporate returns. I also feel it inappropriate for even an exceptionally profitable company to fund an operation once it appears to have unending losses in prospect. Adam Smith would disagree with my first proposition and Karl Marx would disagree with my second; the middle ground is the only position that leaves me comfortable.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.content: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: It is easy to be brave from a safe distance.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: It is with our passions, as it is with fire and water, they are good servants but bad masters.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: Persuasion is often more effectual than force.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: The smaller the mind the greater the conceit.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.content: Before God we are all equally wise - and equally foolish.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Ethical axioms are found and tested not very differently from the axioms of science. Truth is what stands the test of experience.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life are based on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received and am still receiving.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love. How on earth can you explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love? Put your hand on a stove for a minute and it seems like an hour. Sit with that special girl for an hour and it seems like a minute. That's relativity.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: I never think of the future - it comes soon enough.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: If I had only known, I would have been a locksmith.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: If you are out to describe the truth, leave elegance to the tailor.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Perfection of means and confusion of ends seems to characterize our age.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been Kindness, Beauty, and Truth. The trite subjects of human efforts, possessions, outward success, luxury have always seemed to me contemptible.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.content: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: Minds, like bodies, will often fall into a pimpled, ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human nature.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: As a cure for worrying, work is better than whisky.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: I never did a day's work in my life.  It was all fun.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: I never did anything worth doing by accident, nor did any of my inventions come by accident
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the labor of thinking.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.content: Genius is one per cent inspiration, ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison
